title: E-Module-Based Instructional Design for Early Childhood Dance Education: Professional Development Through Project Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners engage in blended learning combining e-modules and offline practice in a BYOD environment, cultivating the ability to design dance education programs for young children as teacher educators.

learning_goals: Learners will be able to systematically explain dance education theories appropriate for early childhood developmental stages using e-module content.
Learners will be able to autonomously design dance education programs for young children through digital platforms and project-based activities.
Learners will be able to demonstrate the ability to apply creative teaching methods in early childhood dance education by achieving over 80 points in summative assessments.

resources: E-Module Platform (Including Theoretical and Practical Videos)
Early Childhood Education Tools (Rhythm Instruments, Image Cards, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
